item.title: Solar tiles could help Germany's transition to solar power
item.description: A startup from Prenzlau, Germany, is seeking to disrupt the solar panels market with new tiles that can be installed on roofs to generate power.

item.title: Holiday rentals push people to the suburbs
item.description: Tenants in Buenos Aires are calling for the regulation of tourist rentals, which affect 20,000 homes and make it more expensive for them to rent them out. Landlords who rent to travelers are opposed and argue that they are making a living. The Argentine capital does not regulate such properties, as do Berlin, Paris, Barcelona, and New York.
item.keywords: DWVC,tenants, Buenos Aires, regulation, tourist rentals, homes, rent, landlords, travelers, Argentina, living
item.media:title: Holiday rentals push people to the suburbs
item.media:keywords: DWVC,tenants, Buenos Aires, regulation, tourist rentals, homes, rent, landlords, travelers, Argentina, living

item.title: Why are researchers so excited about Mars?
item.description: Mars is more than 56 million kilometers from Earth. It is only 384,400 km to the moon. Why is research still more interested in Mars? @DW
item.media:title: Why are researchers so excited about Mars?

item.title: Rape used as a weapon in the Tigray conflict
item.description: The war in northern Ethiopia ranks among the deadliest conflicts in recent times. UN investigators say rape was also used as a weapon of war. With a ceasefire agreed, more and more stories of atrocities are emerging. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,war, Ethiopia, Tigray, conflict, violence, UN investigation, rape, ceasefire, atrocities, human rights
